channel.title: Mouse stops working randomly
channel.description: The mouse for my computer stops working randomly (No, its not lag -.-) and it wont work again until the drivers are re-installed. Any ideas what this is?

item.title: Mouse stops working randomly
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:22, topic:435521”][quote author=Daginith link=topic=538240.msg3940447#msg3940447 date=1331391547]

[quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=538240.msg3939522#msg3939522 date=1331307458]

Idk anyone personally thats got a virus using linux. ofc its possible but people don’t try to spread virus’s to linux… thats why theres next to no virus protection software for ubtuntu lol…

Exactly my point, lol, and Ubuntu is way more secure than my Linux.
[/quote]I don’t see how you see that … RedHat Linux or Mandrake Linux is some pretty secure stuffs

@ op well…if you are not getting an error there are possibly two ideas as to why this is happening that is left.

  1. Your pin on the ps2 cable is probably getting loose/bent
  2. While Linux is very compatible with most hardware there are still some glitchy ones out there.

Well, i got a new mouse and its working fine. I tried the ‘Glitched mouse’ on another computer and it works fine as well. Its weird that it stopped working after a few months, but oh well.

Also, I thought Ubuntu was made for inexperienced Linux users, so it more safe, and has patches. As opposed to ArchLinux, which includes nothing and is made for experienced users.

Thx guys for your help
[/quote]True, but you won’t be doing as much on archlinux as you will be on regular ubuntu thats why it’s safer overall.

and after you saying what you did it probably was just a hardware issue with ubuntu.[/quote]
Im going to submit a bug report to ArchLinux right now, in case anyone else is having this issue.

Read full topic

item.title: Mouse stops working randomly
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote=“heatrn11, post:15, topic:435521”][quote author=Daginith link=topic=538240.msg3938737#msg3938737 date=1331249276]

Try disabling the mouse. Rebooting your system then reienabling it.

I’ve tried that. Its like the drivers keep deleting them selves.

if the driver delete’s it’s self it’s either a virus or the there is not much space on your hard disk.

Uhrm. Linux cant get viruses very easy. and i have a 1TB drive and less than 100GB used. So, i dont believe thats the case.
[/quote]
But they can still get viruses, like my old one.[/quote]
Uhrm, I really don’t think its a virus that is causing this.

Read full topic

item.title: Mouse stops working randomly
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:11, topic:435521”][quote author=Daginith link=topic=538240.msg3937826#msg3937826 date=1331170527]

Did you update your drivers recently?
Is this a laptop or a desktop?
What operating system?

Updated like 2 months ago or so, so its the newest ones.
i have a Linux OS (ArchLinux) and its a Desktop PC

Software which involves your mouse is most probably crashing, I’m not an expert but I don’t think thats a common occurance and it’ll take a long while to get it fixed maybe it’d be faster jsut to back your stuff up and reformat then again it might be an easy fix ofc.

Oh, the happy thoughts.
[/quote]I had the same issue for a long time. Does the device manager say that the ps2 mouse driver is working properly or does it give a case 32 error[/quote]
Nah, its weird. Its giving no error at all.

Read full topic
